name: df-mzpcl
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6
body: |- wceq(cmzpcl, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cpw(co(cz, cmap, co(cz, cmap, cv(s0)))), wa(wa(wral(s2, cz, wcel(cxp(co(cz, cmap, cv(s0)), csn(cv(s2))), cv(s1))), wral(s3, cv(s0), wcel(cmpt(s4, co(cz, cmap, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s4), cv(s3))), cv(s1)))), wral(s5, cv(s1), wral(s6, cv(s1), wa(wcel(co(cv(s5), cof(caddc), cv(s6)), cv(s1)), wcel(co(cv(s5), cof(cmul), cv(s6)), cv(s1)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ mzPolyCld =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà P((‚Ñ§[‚Ü¶](‚Ñ§[‚Ü¶]s0)))|((‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà ‚Ñ§,((‚Ñ§[‚Ü¶]s0)√ó { s2 })‚àà s1)‚àß ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà s0,(s4 ‚àà(‚Ñ§[‚Ü¶]s0)‚Ü¶(s4 ` s3))‚àà s1))‚àß ‚àÄ(s5 ‚àà s1, ‚àÄ(s6 ‚àà s1,((s5[oF(+)]s6)‚àà s1 ‚àß(s5[oF(√ó)]s6)‚àà s1))))})
comment: Define the polynomially closed function rings over an arbitrary index set ` v ` . The set ` ( mzPolyCld `` v ) ` contains all sets of functions from ` ( ZZ ^m v ) ` to ` ZZ ` which include all constants and projections and are closed under addition and multiplication. This is a "temporary" set used to define the polynomial function ring itself ` ( mzPoly `` v ) ` ; see ~ df-mzp . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 4-Oct-2014.)
